repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
One line change to make sure filetype detection runs e.g. on `:e https://google.com/index.html` 

See https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/34140#issuecomment-3436150091

Edit: added another commit to mark buffer as unmodified so that it can be reloaded without `:e!` and user is not prompt to save when closing.

comment_data.body: `vim.cmd('filetype detect')` could be used here too, not sure what's best
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -28,6 +28,7 @@ local function on_remote_read(args)
 
       local lines = vim.split(content.body, '\n', { plain = true })
       vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines(bufnr, 0, -1, true, lines)
+      vim.api.nvim_exec_autocmds('BufRead', { group = 'filetypedetect', buffer = bufnr })

comment_data.body: iirc filetype detect will also use ft from modeline
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -28,6 +28,7 @@ local function on_remote_read(args)
 
       local lines = vim.split(content.body, '\n', { plain = true })
       vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines(bufnr, 0, -1, true, lines)
+      vim.api.nvim_exec_autocmds('BufRead', { group = 'filetypedetect', buffer = bufnr })

comment_data.body: same with the current code, I've tried it with a modeline and it works
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -28,6 +28,7 @@ local function on_remote_read(args)
 
       local lines = vim.split(content.body, '\n', { plain = true })
       vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines(bufnr, 0, -1, true, lines)
+      vim.api.nvim_exec_autocmds('BufRead', { group = 'filetypedetect', buffer = bufnr })

comment_data.body: this is wrong actually, because modified will be set to false from the beginning, and this needs to wait until the buffer is loaded
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -39,6 +39,34 @@ describe('vim.net.request', function()
     )
   end)
 
+  it('detects filetype for remote content', function()
+    t.skip(skip_integ, 'NVIM_TEST_INTEG not set: skipping network integration test')
+
+    local ft = exec_lua([[
+      vim.cmd('runtime! plugin/nvim/net.lua')
+      vim.cmd('runtime! filetype.lua')
+      -- github raw dump of a small lua file in the neovim repo
+      vim.cmd('edit https://raw.githubusercontent.com/neovim/neovim/master/runtime/syntax/tutor.lua')
+      vim.wait(2000, function() return vim.bo.filetype ~= '' end)
+      return vim.bo.filetype
+    ]])
+
+    assert(ft == 'lua')
+  end)
+
+  it('removes the modified flag from the buffer for remote content', function()
+    t.skip(skip_integ, 'NVIM_TEST_INTEG not set: skipping network integration test')
+
+    local buffer_modified = exec_lua([[
+      vim.cmd('runtime! plugin/nvim/net.lua')
+      vim.cmd('edit https://raw.githubusercontent.com/neovim/neovim/master/runtime/syntax/tutor.lua')
+      vim.wait(2000, function() return vim.bo.modified == false end)

comment_data.body: @tampueroc this is currently failing, but I'm not sure why, as when you open a remote url in neovim and then run `:= vim.bo.modified` it returns false
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -39,6 +39,36 @@ describe('vim.net.request', function()
     )
   end)
 
+  it('detects filetype for remote content', function()
+    t.skip(skip_integ, 'NVIM_TEST_INTEG not set: skipping network integration test')
+
+    local ft = exec_lua([[
+      vim.cmd('runtime! plugin/nvim/net.lua')
+      vim.cmd('runtime! filetype.lua')
+      -- github raw dump of a small lua file in the neovim repo
+      vim.cmd('edit https://raw.githubusercontent.com/neovim/neovim/master/runtime/syntax/tutor.lua')
+      vim.wait(2000, function() return vim.bo.filetype ~= '' end)
+      return vim.bo.filetype
+    ]])
+
+    assert(ft == 'lua')
+  end)
+
+  it('removes the modified flag from the buffer for remote content', function()
+    t.skip(skip_integ, 'NVIM_TEST_INTEG not set: skipping network integration test')
+
+    local buffer_modified = exec_lua([[
+      vim.cmd('runtime! plugin/nvim/net.lua')
+      vim.cmd('edit https://raw.githubusercontent.com/neovim/neovim/master/runtime/syntax/tutor.lua')
+      -- wait for buffer to have content
+      vim.wait(2000, function() return vim.fn.wordcount().bytes > 0 end)
+      vim.wait(2000, function() return vim.bo.modified == false end)
+      return vim.bo.modified
+    ]])
+
+    assert(not buffer_modified)

comment_data.body:
nevermind, fixed it by adding:

```
      vim.cmd('runtime! filetype.lua')
```

comment_regular_data.body: @michelesr Can you add a small test in `net_spec.lua`? You should be able to validate filetype with `:echo &filetype`!

> @michelesr Can you add a small test in `net_spec.lua`? You should be able to validate filetype with `:echo &filetype`!

```lua
  it('detects filetype for remote content', function()
    t.skip(skip_integ, 'NVIM_TEST_INTEG not set: skipping network integration test')

    local ft = exec_lua([[
      vim.cmd(':e https://raw.githubusercontent.com/neovim/neovim/master/runtime/lua/vim/filetype.lua')
      vim.wait(2000, function() return vim.bo.filetype ~= '' end)
      return vim.bo.filetype
    ]])

    assert(ft == 'lua')
  end)
```

tried this but it doesn't work as filetype (and the buffer content) is empty... any clue how to fix it?

There are 2 things that I can't make work in the tests:

- the edit command doesn't work for remote files, it can load a local file but not a url, the buffer content remains empty when used with a url
- even with a local lua file, `vim.bo.filetype` is not set to `'lua'`

The root cause seems to be autocmds not being executed when the :edit command runs.

@tampueroc I believe autocommands are [disabled](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/6d72094b1b20d65fc1a7943453d5d761902dbce6/test/functional/testnvim.lua#L45) on tests, I'm not sure how to test the remote file opening (I tried to use `vim.inspect(vim.api.nvim_get_autocmds({group = "nvim.net.remotefile"}))` but I got the error saying the group is not valid)

> @tampueroc I believe autocommands are [disabled](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/6d72094b1b20d65fc1a7943453d5d761902dbce6/test/functional/testnvim.lua#L45) on tests, I'm not sure how to test the remote file opening (I tried to use `vim.inspect(vim.api.nvim_get_autocmds({group = "nvim.net.remotefile"}))` but I got the error saying the group is not valid)

You might need to load the plugins before e.g 
```lua
('detects filetype for remote content', function()
    t.skip(skip_integ, 'NVIM_TEST_INTEG not set: skipping network integration test')

    local ft = exec_lua([[
      vim.cmd('runtime! plugin/nvim/net.lua')
      vim.cmd('runtime! filetype.lua')
      vim.cmd(':e https://raw.githubusercontent.com/neovim/neovim/master/runtime/lua/vim/filetype.lua')
      vim.wait(2000, function() return done end)
      return vim.bo.filetype
      ]])

    assert(ft == 'lua', 'Expected filetype to be "lua", got: ' .. tostring(ft))
  end)
```
@tampueroc added the test, thanks for the help
@tampueroc managed to fix the broken tests on the 2nd commit, if you want to have a look: thanks for the patience!

> @tampueroc managed to fix the broken tests on the 2nd commit, if you want to have a look: thanks for the patience!

Nice! I'm not a maintainer, so I can't formally approve the PR, but the implementation looks solid to me.
A couple of suggestions (nits):
- Use `vim.bo[bufnr].modified = false` instead of `vim.api.nvim_set_option_value('modified', false, { buf = bufnr })`
- Clearer assert messages
```
assert(ft == 'lua', 'Expected filetype to be "lua", got: ' .. tostring(ft))
assert(not buffer_modified, 'Expected buffer to be unmodified for remote content')
```
- Clearer commit messages so they follow [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages) guidelines

> > @tampueroc managed to fix the broken tests on the 2nd commit, if you want to have a look: thanks for the patience!
> 
> Nice! I'm not a maintainer, so I can't formally approve the PR, but the implementation looks solid to me. A couple of suggestions: ...

thanks, I've implemented the suggestions, hope it looks better now!

title: net.lua: run ftdetect and mark buffer unmodified for remote url content
